#taxgroup Reptiles species Gopher Snake / Pituophis catenifer
#
# Nestsite
-99
# Foraging Habitat
-99
# Forage/Prey Availability
-99
# Predator Avoidance
-99
# Refugia/Shelter
-99
# Literature
Distribution
central and western USA, south into Mexico and north into southwestern Canada
General Habitat
variety of habitats from relatively dry desert regions to more moist agricultural regions; may occur in dry forests but seldom in moist forests
Home or Activity Range
no information available
Specific Habitat Preferences
areas with rodent burrows, rocky crevices, abundant small mammal populations
Nestsite Characteristics
thought to lay eggs in burrows or deep in rocky crevices
Foraging Habitat Characteristics
investigates burrows, brush, rocks, or debris
Diet
mostly small mammals, birds, bird young
Predators
birds, predaceous fish, large amphibians, some snakes and mammals, predaceous beetles
Shelter Habitats
seek refuge under rocks, debris, or in rodent burrows; winter in communal den sites in rocks or burrows
Response to Disturbance
no information available
General Sources of Background Information
Storm and Leonard 1995
Summaries of Specific Studies
no information available
